The idiom अंधेरे में झांकना (Andhera mein jhanakna) is a Hindi idiom that means "to look into the future" or "to speculate about something". The Chinese idiom "看不见的风景" (Kan bu jian de fengjing) also means "to look into the future" or "to speculate about something". The idiomatic sense of the Chinese idiom in Hindi is "अग्नि के बाद की दिशा देखना" (Agni ke baad ki disha dekhnaa). The idiom is used to describe someone who is always thinking about the future or is overly concerned about what might happen. The idiom is a metaphorical expression that means to look into the future or to speculate about something. The literal translation of the idiom is "to look into the darkness", but the idiomatic sense is to look at something superficially without understanding its true nature. The correct answer is A) To look at something superficially without understanding its true nature.

It's a reminder to stay disciplined and prioritize tasks before indulging in leisure activities.
